text: the internet's busiest music nerdy and
it's time for a review of this new
Macklemore album Ben McLemore Seattle's
Great Rap motivator he is back with his
first full-length album in about six
years and at this point it's kind of
weird to look back on that gap of time
and the brief run that he had before it
McLemore's been active since the early
2000s but didn't actually experience a
blow up until 10 years later with
dramatic inspirational commentary packed
singles like wings and Same Love as well
as Can't Hold Us oh and who can forget
the real defining hit of his career the
silly Frugal boy Anthem Thrift Shop
these tracks would go on to help make up
his breakout album with producer Ryan
Lewis The Heist which hasn't aged as
well as it could have with its slightly
out of touch social critiques slightly
corny humor and a few weird outliers
like the song cowboy boots but the
project was decent enough and certainly
one of the more interesting hip-hop
records to hit the mainstream that that
year late 2012 I think most people were
content to let Mac have his moment even
if his style and Vibe wasn't exactly
their cup of tea The Heist didn't start
getting backlash backlash until the
hubristic bubble it was living in popped
because the heist exists in headspace
where its success was earned on Merit
alone just look at the intro where Matt
claims to have put in his 10 000 hours
and also remember that this album was
produced and released independently
totally independently and I think most
people do like to see an artist make it
who is not a part of the label stable
but still that doesn't change the fact
that from the moment McLemore had hits
the entertainment industry was so
desperate and so quick to turn him into
the Next Great White Hope for hip-hop
and I don't think the gravity and harm
of that framing really hit everyone
until 2014 when the heist beat out one
of the greatest concept albums of all
time good kid Mad City for rap album of
the year what is usually the highlight
of any artist music career became a
blemish of tone DeForest racial bias in
the music industry now since then
McLemore's career has kind of been one
of diminishing returns the next album he
did with Ryan Lewis mostly felt like a
bloated and over budget sequel to The
Heist and the feature heavy solo effort
Gemini he put out a year later was
handily the worst record he had released
up until that point which is sort of
what has me worried here about Ben
because this is another solo outing for
Mac though Ryan is in the mix a little

could have been enough time for a reset
or a redirection for Mac a time to kind
of collect his uh thoughts and
aspirations artistically many of the

the straight and narrow being a dad and
